thread.title: Ground News - Shropshire river levels expected to peak today after Storm Gerrit battering
thread.title_full: Ground News - Shropshire river levels expected to peak today after Storm Gerrit battering

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Shropshire river levels expected to peak today after Storm Gerrit battering
text:
Summary by Ground News Flood warning issued for The Quarry and The Showground in Shrewsbury. River levels expected to peak at Welsh Bridge on Friday evening. Comes after county was hit by strong winds and rain from Storm Gerrit. Storm uprooted trees and also appears to have been responsible for a huge 'bang', heard in Bridgnorth. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
Shropshire Star Media Conglomerate: MNA Media Shropshire river levels expected to peak today after Storm Gerrit battering Flood defences were put up in Shrewsbury and Ironbridge earlier this week as the Environment Agency prepared for the impact of the swollen River Severn. A flood warning issued for Shrewsbury on Thursday afternoon said that flooding of property, roads and farmland is "expected" and that the river is likely to peak at the Welsh Bridge on Friday evening.
5 hours ago · Ketley, United Kingdom Read Full Article
